function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Model estimation errors for susceptible cases, confirmed infections, recovered individuals, and deaths.","Impact":"Inaccurate model predictions and policy decisions, leading to ineffective disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and adjustment of model parameters based on observed data and the use of more accurate estimation techniques.","Technologies":"Advanced modeling and simulation tools, data analytics and machine learning algorithms, real-time data collection and analysis systems.","People":"Health authorities, policymakers, and the general public.","Owner":"Research institutions, health organizations, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Endogenous determination and estimation of the Compliance Index from the model.","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of compliance by the public to policy measures, leading to misinformed policy decisions and ineffective disease control measures.","Mitigation":"Validation and refinement of the compliance estimation process, utilization of additional external compliance data sources, and regular assessment of compliance dynamics.","Technologies":"Data analytics, machine learning algorithms, social behavior tracking systems, and real-time compliance monitoring tools.","People":"Research institutions, policymakers, and health organizations.","Owner":"Government agencies and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Interplay of time-varying Stringency Index and Compliance Index with infection rates.","Impact":"Lack of understanding of the effect of policy measures and public compliance on the movement of infection rates, leading to suboptimal disease control strategies.","Mitigation":"Comprehensive analysis of the relationship between policy measures, public compliance, and infection rates, real-time monitoring of policy impact, and adaptive policy adjustments.","Technologies":"Data analytics, modeling and simulation tools, machine learning algorithms, real-time data collection and analysis systems.","People":"Health authorities, policymakers, and researchers.","Owner":"Health organizations, research institutions, and government agencies."}]}
